paragraph: I have again to thank you for the many kind and delightful letters which I have received from all parts of the world, and I cannot tell you how happy I am to find that I have succeeded so well in pleasing you with my stories.
tokens: have thank many kind delightful letter receive part world tell happy find succeed pleasing story

paragraph: What am I to say to the little boy who wrote, and begged “that, if the Wallypug came to stay with me again, would I please invite him too?” or to the other dear little fellow who came to me with tears in his eyes, to tell me that some superior grown-up person had informed him that “there never was a Wallypug, and it was all just a pack of nonsense”; that “Girlie never went to Why at all, and that in fact there was no such place in existence”?
tokens: say little boy write begg come stay invite other dear little fellow come tear eye tell superior grow person inform be pack nonsense go fact be such place existence

paragraph: I can only regretfully admit that, sooner or later as we grow up to be men and women, there are bound to be many fond illusions which are one by one ruthlessly dispelled, and that many of the dreams and thoughts which, in our younger days, we cherish most dearly, the hard, matter-of-fact world will always persist in describing as “a pack of nonsense.” However, for many of us fortunately, this tiresome time has not yet arrived, and for the present we will refuse to give up our poor dear Wallypug—for whom I declare I have as great an affection and regard, as the most enthusiastic of my young readers.
tokens: admit grow man woman be bound many fond illusion dispell many dream thought young day cherish hard matter fact world persist describe pack nonsense many tiresome time arrive present refuse give poor dear declare have great affection regard enthusiastic young reader

paragraph: You will see that in the following story I have described my own experiences during a recent visit to the remarkable land over which His Majesty reigns as a “kind of king”, and I may tell you that, amongst all of the extraordinary creatures that I met there, there was not one who expressed the slightest doubt as to the reality of what was happening; while for my own part, I should as soon think of doubting the existence of the fairies themselves, as of the simple, kind-hearted, little Wallypug.
tokens: see follow story describe own experience recent visit remarkable land reign kind king tell extraordinary creature meet be express slight doubt reality happen own part think doub existence fairy simple kind hearted little

paragraph: There now! I hope that I have given quite a clear and lucid explanation, and one which will prevent you from being made unhappy by any doubts which may arise in your mind as to the possibility, or probability, of this story. Please don’t forget to write to me again during the coming year.
tokens: hope give clear lucid explanation prevent make unhappy doubt arise mind possibility probability story forget write come year
